text.p: English premier league club Derby have signed Estonian international goalkeeper Mart Poom from FC Flora Tallinn for 500,000 pounds sterling ($808,000).

The former Portsmouth player, who also had a loan spell at Leeds, was in goal when Estonia held Scotland to a 0-0 World Cup draw in February and is due to play against the Scots in Saturday's return match at Kilmarnock.
Poom has been Estonia's regular goalkeeper since the country returned to international soccer in 1991 and, with more than 40 appearances to his name, is their most-capped player since independence.
"I felt we needed a top quality goalkeeper," said Derby manager Jim Smith.
"I had Mart when I was at Portsmouth and always felt that technically he could be a top keeper, especially given his desire to work."
Poom is likely to make his debut for Derby in their league game at Manchester United on April 5.
"I promised myself I'd be back in English football and the chance has come sooner than I expected,'' said Poom.
